dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Two hundred and thirty-five billion dollars? Are you kidding me?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Two hundred and thirty-five billion dollars? Are you kidding me?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's Netflix's market cap, Host_A, the day before earnings. Up almost a hundred billion in 2020.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's Netflix's market cap, Host_A, the day before earnings. Up almost a hundred billion in twenty twenty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: $235 Billion That's Netflix's market capitalization the day before it's set to release third-quarter earnings. It's up nearly $100 billion in 2020 alone, making the 23-year-old streaming giant one of the 20 largest companies on the S&P 500 by market capahead of even media mainstays like Walt Disney, Comcast and AT&T.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A hundred billion? Just like, poof? I mean, come on, that's gotta be, uh, pure pandemic hype.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A hundred billion? Just like, poof? I mean, come on, that's gotta be, uh, pure pandemic hype.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, their shares have soared over sixty percent since January. The S&P 500 is up, like, six and a half percent for comparison.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, their shares have soared over sixty percent since January. The S&P five hundred is up, like, six and a half percent for comparison.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 60% Netflix shares have soared more than 60% since the beginning of the year. To compare, the S&P 500 is up just 6.5% in 2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but that's exactly it! Everyone was stuck at home. That's not, you know, real growth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but that's exactly it! Everyone was stuck at home. That's not, you know, real growth.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Even their CEO, Reed Hastings, he's gotten nearly two billion dollars during the pandemic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Even their C E O, Reed Hastings, he's gotten nearly two billion dollars during the pandemic.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The firm's billionaire cofounder and CEO, Reed Hastings, has gotten nearly $2 billion during the pandemic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Two billion? For him? While everyone else is, like, just trying to make rent? That just screams unsustainable, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Two billion? For him? While everyone else is, like, just trying to make rent? That just screams unsustainable, doesn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They're expecting 195 million paid subscribers, Host_A. They added twenty-six million in the first half of the year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're expecting one hundred ninety five million paid subscribers, Host_A. They added twenty-six million in the first half of the year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 195 Million That's the number of paid subscribers analysts expect Netflix will report on Tuesday, up 2.5 million quarter to quarter and in line with the firm's latest guidance. Netflix said in July that it added 26 million subscribers during the first half of the year (10 million in the first quarter and nearly 16 million in the second) as homebound consumers facing government-mandated quarantine orders turned to the streaming giantand away from movie theaters and live showsfor entertainment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, because they had to. People were literally locked inside. Where else were they gonna go for entertainment?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, because they had to. People were literally locked inside. Where else were they gonna go for entertainment?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And nearly six point four billion in third-quarter revenues. Up over twenty percent from last year, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And nearly six point four billion in third-quarter revenues. Up over twenty percent from last year, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: $6.4 Billion Analysts are expecting Netflix will pull nearly $6.4 billion in third-quarter revenues, up more than 20% from the same period last year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, but it says their earnings are expected to be two dollars thirteen cents per share, down from one dollar forty-seven last year? That math just doesn't add up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, but it says their earnings are expected to be two dollars thirteen cents per share, down from one dollar forty-seven last year? That math just doesn't add up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company's also expected to report earnings of about $2.13 per share, down from $1.47 per share last year on heightened costs amid the pandemic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, yeah, the article says "down from one dollar forty-seven per share last year on heightened costs." So, higher costs, I guess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, yeah, the article says down from one dollar forty-seven per share last year on heightened costs. So, higher costs, I guess.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company's also expected to report earnings of about $2.13 per share, down from $1.47 per share last year on heightened costs amid the pandemic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Higher costs." Right. So, less profit per share despite all these, like, huge numbers you're throwing around. Sounds super stable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Higher costs. Right. So, less profit per share despite all these, like, huge numbers you're throwing around. Sounds super stable.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Bank of America just issued a six hundred and seventy dollar price target for them, Host_A. The highest on Wall Street.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Bank of America just issued a six hundred and seventy dollar price target for them, Host_A. The highest on Wall Street.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: $670 That's the price target Bank of America issued on Friday for Netflix, up nearly 17% from a prior target of $575 and representing the highest Netflix price target on Wall Street.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Bank of America. Of course. And the average analyst price target is, what, five twenty-seven? So BofA is just, like, an outlier, trying to pump it up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Bank of America. Of course. And the average analyst price target is, what, five twenty-seven? So BofA is just, like, an outlier, trying to pump it up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix's average price target from 39 analysts covering its stock is about $527within 1% of current prices.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They're saying the acceleration in subscriber growth is a "permanent benefit."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're saying the acceleration in subscriber growth is a permanent benefit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite near-term uncertainties around second-half subscriber growthand a highly criticized movie release, Bank of America said it continues to see the acceleration in Netflix subscriber growth during the first half of the year as a permanent benefit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: "Permanent benefit." Uh huh. We'll see how "permanent" that is once people can actually, like, leave their houses again.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Permanent benefit. Uh huh. We'll see how permanent that is once people can actually, like, leave their houses again.
